chat_history.message:
Hello,

My Galaxy S21+ 5G has a problem:
The screen started flashing white, even when the phone is turned off. It seems that the phone works fine and everything else is correct. Nothing has been hit or anything, so maybe something just got out of alignment. Thank you.

Thank you,

Hello Eduardo: You will find the return label attached to this message. Chronopost will process your return. Please choose a place that is comfortable for you to send your package. You can find a list of delivery points here: https://www.seur.com/en/busqueda-tiendas.do Preparing Your Return: 1. Check the instructions on how to return a product 2. Don't forget to include any accessories that came with your article 3. Remove any protective film or screen protector it has 4. Package your article and its accessories following these guidelines Packaging Your Article: • The box must be strong and resilient. You should place your article safely inside the box so it doesn't move during transportation. • Attach the return label to the top of the box (you can also add an additional label on the inside to help identify your shipment if the original label peels off or becomes damaged). • Take photos of the interior and exterior of your package before sending it. This will protect you in case your article is damaged during transportation. Your return is ready for shipping! We'll let you know when it arrives. Best regards, The Customer Service Team at Back Market, The Customer Service Team at Back Market

Hola, agente
El vendedor no puede proceder al reenvío debido al siguiente motivo:
Otros.
Se ha añadido más información en este mensaje: Dear Backcare,

In the event that our repair team is unable to fix the issue, we are more than willing to offer a refund to the customer. 
However, the device was purchased in EXCELLENT condition, which indicates that it is free of scratches according to the Quality Charter. As seen from the pictures attached, the back of the device is damaged upon return. 
The customer has had the device for a certain amount of time, which suggests that he was satisfied with the device condition upon receipt. Now that the device has been damaged upon return, the grade is degraded to a FAIR condition.

Hence, a 60 euros deduction to the refund is reasonable. Kindly confirm with the customer if this is agreeable.
Thank you.

Regards,
AS

Dear ecomobile 

Unfortunately, deduct money of the full refund, is no longer possible, now! 

Please, contact with the SSC, and refund the order.

Sincerely, 
Manuel from the Back Care Team

Hola, agente
El vendedor no puede proceder al reenvío debido al siguiente motivo:
Otros.
Se ha añadido más información en este mensaje: Dear Backcare,

The device was purchased as an EXCELLENT condition. According to the Quality Charter, EXCELLENT condition requires the device to be free of scratches on the shell. The customer has had the device for almost a year. This suggests that he was satisfied with the device condition upon receipt.

The phone also had visible scratches before the customer returned the device to us, as seen in the photos attached by them. As such the grade is degraded to a FAIR condition.

Hence, a €60 deduction will be made in the event our repair team is unable to fix the device. Please check with the customer on this.

Thank you.

Regards,
JY

Hi ecomobile,

Just a friendly reminder that the customer is waiting for their full refund, since we cannot deduct money by grade discrepancy. 

Please provide it, customer within the next (1) business day, or unfortunately we’ll have to refund the order, according to the Back Market Quality Charter.

We have listed some issues with their corresponding resolutions here in case these are preventing you from carrying out the refund. Please use the "Report a Problem" button on the bottom of the screen to declare an issue with the customer's return and stop a refund from being made on your behalf.

1. In case of a delivery issue: https://backmarketportal.force.com/ssc/s/article/How-to-manage-a-transport-issue-lost-stolen-damaged-parcel

2. In case of a user account (e.g. iCloud, Google) still connected: 
iCloud: 
https://backmarketportal.force.com/ssc/s/article/What-to-do-with-a-device-locked-to-iCloud

Google: https://backmarketportal.force.com/ssc/s/article/How-to-manage-a-product-blocked-with-an-account-Android-Google

3. In case of a warranty exclusion: https://backmarketportal.force.com/ssc/s/article/Declare-and-manage-warranty-exclusion

Thanks for your help in keeping our shared customers happy!

Sincerely, 
Manuel Back Market customer Care

Dear Backcare,

Unfortunately, our repair team was unable to resolve the issue.

However as mentioned above, the device was purchased as an EXCELLENT condition. According to the Quality Charter, EXCELLENT condition requires the device to be free of scratches on the shell. The customer has had the device for almost a year. This suggests that he was satisfied with the device condition upon receipt.

The phone also had visible scratches before the customer returned the device to us,. As such the grade is degraded to a FAIR condition.

Hence,we are unable to offer a full refund and a €60 deduction will be made. Please check with the customer on this.

Thank you.

Regards,
JH

Hello ecomobile,

We would like to inform you that, in accordance with our Quality Charter, we have refunded €355,00 to the customer, given that you couldn't repair or replace the device.

Please contact with the SSC, if necessary.

Kind regards, 
Manuel from Back Market
